course.title: Refrigerants – Properties and Classification
course.description: We will now analyse someproperties of refrigerants that qualify them as greener refrigerants over years.

topic.title: Objective
topic.text:
In this section, we will learn:

  • List properties of refrigerants.
  • Classify refrigerants based on their levels of purity.
  • Draw Log P-h graph for zeotropic refrigerants.
  • Identify properties of greener refrigerants based on various protocols.

text.p: Refrigerants are substances used in heat cycle which undergoes reversible phase change from liquid to gas or vapour.

Azeotropic and zeotropic refrigerants

A refrigerant can either be a pure chemical compound (azeotropic refrigerant) or a mixture/blend of more refrigerants (zeotropic refrigerant).

An ideal refrigerant should have good thermodynamic properties.

  • Boiling point - Below the target temperature.
  • High heat of vaporization.
  • Moderate density in liquid form.
  • Relatively high density in gaseous form.
  • High critical temperature.
  • Global Warming Potential (GWP) should be < 150.
  • Ozone Depletion Potential (ODP) = 0.
  • Total Equivalent Warming Impact (TEWI) should be low.
  • Evaporator outlet pressure (Po) should be greater than atmospheric pressure.
  • Chemically stable inside the refrigeration system.

Note: since boiling point and density are affected by pressure, selection of refrigerant should be according to the application by choice of operating pressure.

t: Click the next / previous arrow  to learn more about selection of refrigerants under different conditions:

interactivity.reveal: Low cost and easy to obtain and handle

text.p: Encouraging investment into new technology. The EU phase down is not based on exactly the same measures as the Montreal Protocol. The Montreal Protocol HFC phase down goes into force on January 1, 2019. At least 20 Parties deposit their instruments of ratification, acceptance or approval by that date.

text.top: First serious phase down step approaches in 2018.

icons.p: Market impact was blurred by stock piling and succeeding unused 2015 quota.
New high GWP equipment was still placed on the market in 2016.
From 2017 imported pre-charged units were included in the quota.
Steep price increases occurred in 2017. Scarcity of HFC on the market since media 2017.

text.p: HVACR contributes to 72% of the phase down in Europe.

topic.title: GWP and CSA number Global Warming Potential (GWP)

text.p:
Global warming potential is a measure of how much a given mass of green house gas is estimated to contribute to global warming.

Chemical Abstract Service number (CAS number)

CAS number is unique numerical identifiers for chemical elements, compounds, polymers, biological sequences, mixtures and alloys.

A CAS registry number is separated by hyphens into three parts, the first consisting of up to 7 digits, the second consisting of two digits, and the third consisting of a single digit serving as a check digit. The numbers are assigned in increasing order and do not have any inherent meaning.

The check digit is calculated by taking the last digit times 1, the next digit times 2, the next digit times 3 etc., adding all these up and computing the sum modular arithmetic 10. For example, the CAS number of water is 7732-18-5: the checksum 5 is calculated as (8×1 + 1×2 + 2×3 + 3×4 + 7×5 + 7×6) = 105; 105 mod 10 = 5.

text.t: Click the below items to learn types of Refrigerants.

interactivity.title: Synthetic gases
interactivity.reveal:
Organic compounds:

  • R22 - Chlorodilfluoromethane (HCFC)
  • R134a - Tetrafluoroethane (HFC)

Zeotropic mixtures:

  • R404 - mix of 3 gases
  • R407C - mix of 3 gases
  • R410A - mix of 2 gases

Azeotropic mixtures:

  • R507 - mix of 2 gases

interactivity.title: Natural gases
interactivity.reveal:
Organic compounds (Hydrocarbons, HC):

  • R290 - Propane
  • R600 - Butane
  • R600a - Iso-butane

Inorganic compounds:

  • R717 Ammonia (NH3)
  • R744 Carbon dioxide (CO2)

text.b:
Zeotropic mixtures: Liquid mixtures which obeys Raoult's law.

Azeotropic mixtures: An Azeotropic mixture, is a mixture of two or more liquids in such a ratio that its composition cannot be changed by simple distillation.

text.t:
Refrigerants can be used based on application.

Click here to view the list of refrigerants.

EN - European standard, ARI - American standard

Click the below items to learn types of Refrigerants.

interactivity.title: High Temp (i.e. Air Conditioning)
interactivity.reveal:
Evaporator Temperature (standards conditions):

EN: +5°C / 41°F
ARI +7,2°C / 45°F 


  • R22 (mainly Asia pacific & Latin America)
  • R407C/R410A (mainly Europe and Middle east & North America)

interactivity.title: Medium Temp (i.e. Refrigerator)
interactivity.reveal:
Evaporator Temperature(standards conditions):

EN: -10°C / 14°F​
ARI -6,7°C / 20°F 


  • R22 (mainly Asia pacific & Latin America)
  • R134a/R404A (mainly Europe and Middle east & North America)
  • R600a (Household – Europe and Middle east)
  • R290 (Europe and Middle east)
  • R744

interactivity.title: Low Temp (i.e. Freezer)
interactivity.reveal:
Evaporator Temperature (standards conditions):

EN: -35°C / -31°F
ARI -31,7°C / -25°F 


  •  R22 (mainly Asia pacific & Latin America))
  • R404A (mainly Europe and Middle east & North America)
  • R507
  • R600a (Household – Europe and Middle east)
  • R290 (Europe and Middle east)

topic.title: Recap
topic.text:
Let us recall:

  • Refrigerants are substances used in heat cycle which undergoes reversible phase change from liquid to gas or vapour.
  • An ideal refrigerant should have good thermodynamic properties.
  • The glide will have consequences for the superheat setting and for the evaporation temperature.
  • Global warming potential is a measure of how much a given mass of green house gas is estimated to contribute to global warming.
  • CAS number is unique numerical identifiers for chemical elements, compounds, polymers, biological sequences, mixtures and alloys.
